region_description: Victoria Falls, known as Mosi-oa-Tunya or 'The Smoke That Thunders,' is one of the largest and most famous waterfalls in the world. Straddling the border between Zimbabwe and Zambia, this natural wonder is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and attracts thousands of visitors each year. The falls are nearly a mile wide and drop over 100 meters into a gorge below, creating a stunning spectacle of mist and rainbows. Visitors can engage in various activities, such as white-water rafting, bungee jumping, and helicopter tours, offering a unique perspective of this magnificent site.

places_to_visit.name: Victoria Falls National Park
places_to_visit.description: Victoria Falls National Park is home to the spectacular waterfall and offers stunning viewpoints along its trails. Visitors can explore the diverse flora and fauna of the park and enjoy various activities, including guided tours and sunset cruises.

places_to_visit.name: Zambezi River
places_to_visit.description: The Zambezi River, which flows into Victoria Falls, offers thrilling adventure activities like white-water rafting and canoeing. The river is also a fantastic place to spot wildlife and enjoy scenic boat cruises.

places_to_visit.name: Livingstone Island
places_to_visit.description: Livingstone Island is a small island located on the Zambezi River, right above the falls. It offers breathtaking views and is the perfect spot for swimming in the Devil’s Pool during the dry season, allowing visitors to experience the falls up close.

places_to_visit.name: Mosi-oa-Tunya National Park
places_to_visit.description: Mosi-oa-Tunya National Park is known for its diverse wildlife, including elephants and various bird species. Visitors can enjoy game drives and guided walking safaris while exploring the park’s natural beauty.

hotels.name: The Victoria Falls Hotel
hotels.description: The Victoria Falls Hotel is a historic hotel offering luxury accommodations and stunning views of the falls. With elegant rooms and fine dining options, it provides a perfect base for exploring the area.

hotels.name: Ilala Lodge Hotel
hotels.description: Ilala Lodge Hotel is a charming hotel located near the falls. It features comfortable accommodations and a restaurant with views of the Zambezi River, making it an ideal choice for travelers.

restaurants.name: The Lookout Cafe
restaurants.description: The Lookout Cafe offers stunning views of Victoria Falls and serves a variety of international and local dishes. It’s a great place to relax and enjoy a meal while taking in the beautiful scenery.

restaurants.name: The Boma – Dinner & Drum Show
restaurants.description: The Boma offers a unique dining experience featuring traditional Zimbabwean cuisine and a lively drum show. Guests can enjoy a cultural evening with great food and entertainment.
